In my case, cudnn64_5.dll wasn't found in the path. I did RTFM but TFM was wrong. i.e. NVidia's instructions to install cuDNN are wrong (nvidia please fix if you see this)

So download cuDNN v5.1 (Jan 20, 2017), for CUDA 8.0 at https://developer.nvidia.com/rdp/cudnn-download

Then do this:

ALL PLATFORMS

    Extract the cuDNN archive to a directory of your choice, referred to below as <installpath>.
    Then follow the platform-specific instructions as follows.

But then it's ...

Wrong

WINDOWS

    Add <installpath> to the PATH environment variable.

Correct

WINDOWS

    Add <installpath>\bin to the PATH environment variable.

body:
In my case, `cudnn64_5.dll` wasn't found in the path. I did RTFM but TFM was wrong. i.e. [NVidia's instructions](http://developer2.download.nvidia.com/compute/machine-learning/cudnn/secure/v5.1/prod/doc/cudnn_install.txt) to install cuDNN are wrong (nvidia please fix if you see this)

So download cuDNN v5.1 (Jan 20, 2017), for CUDA 8.0 at https://developer.nvidia.com/rdp/cudnn-download 

Then do this:

```
ALL PLATFORMS

    Extract the cuDNN archive to a directory of your choice, referred to below as <installpath>.
    Then follow the platform-specific instructions as follows.
```

But then it's ... 
## Wrong
```
WINDOWS

    Add <installpath> to the PATH environment variable.
```

## Correct
```
WINDOWS

    Add <installpath>\bin to the PATH environment variable.
```
